page.title: 11History of Wistow & Raveley
page.content: The block is not rich in monuments and museums, but relics from Pre-Historic and Roman times from the area are housed in the Norris Museum at St. Ives. Nevertheless the block has historical value, a Romano-British settlement identified at Wistow and a later Anglo-Saxon estate at Wistow. This was granted to Ramsey Abbey when the Benedictene Monastery was founded in 974. The Abbot had certain powers over Wistow and Great Raveley. In the l6th Century the powerfull Cromwell family acquired several Ramsey Abbey manors such as those of the Raveleys and Wistow. In the l7th Century the manor of Little Raveley was one of 4 manors owned by the Earl of Sandwich. During the l8th Century there was rapid development of the Fenland waterways for transport and landing stages were maintained at Gt. Raveley.
